Title.evidence: Background: We aimed to determine with this randomized, triple-masked, placebo-controlled study

Trial_Design.evidence: Subjects were randomized to receive either perineural ropivacaine 0.4% or normal saline

Participants.evidence: 60 subjects undergoing unilateral (n = 24) or bilateral (n = 36) mastectomy

Intervention.evidence: Subjects were randomized to receive either perineural ropivacaine 0.4% or normal saline

Objective.evidence: We aimed to determine with this randomized, triple-masked, placebo-controlled study if benefits are afforded by adding a multiple-day, ambulatory, continuous ropivacaine paravertebral nerve block

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary end point was average pain (scale: 0–10) queried on postoperative day (POD) 1.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Subjects were randomized to receive either perineural ropivacaine 0.4% or normal saline

Number_Randomised.evidence: 60 subjects undergoing unilateral (n = 24) or bilateral (n = 36) mastectomy

Number_Analysed.evidence: Average pain queried on POD 1 for subjects receiving perineural ropivacaine (n=30)
